p.s: Michel Barnier's speech at the European American Chamber of Commerce in New York was held on the 10th July 2018 and is about the consequences of Brexit as well as the characteristics of a close relationship between the UK and the EU.
Michel Barnier is an EU commissioner for the withdrawal negatiations of the UK in the course of Brexit.
The consequences listed by Barnier are mainly based on economic reasons and include the created friction, which will have an impact on the value chains of multiple economic sectors.
He also states that the cost for the UK would be substantially higher than the EU's, but it would still be an unfavourable situation for both sides.
Furthermore he warns US firms to analyse their supply chains and existing contracts in view of Brexit.

For the characteristics of a close relationship between the two unions he describes one similar to that of the USA and the EU, which was achieved by opening the EU Single Market for third countries like the US and the UK.
As another option he lists the inclusion of the right of establishment in future Free Trade Agreements.
